TopicTitle: The worst thing about watching KSP on YouTube.

Articles.Content: The thing I find most frustrating about watch a Kerbal Space Program video on YouTube. Is that once in a while I try to grub the screen and try to rotate the view.

Yup! Once i yelled "Thats a lunar probe you dont need a barometer!" at a lets play as if the person could hear me. (Though it's been made useful in vacuum since then.)

My biggest problem is the video just making me want to play KSP so i don't finish the video.
Been there done that with pictures too.

I was watching a twitch stream and filled the chat bar with ............................... when I tried to timewarp. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

To be honest, the worst thing about watching someone play KSP is when they make a simple, tiny, mistake building their rocket, then spend 30 minutes trying to figure it out.

Meanwhile I'm yelling at the screen, "Your fuel line is backwards dumba\*\*!"

My problem is the same as I have with the What did you do in KSP today? thread... 

You people make nice pretty and functional builds... Mine are functional (sort of) but butt ugly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is me with pretty much every game I play. Tis the curse of having almost 1500 hours.

I remember watching a stream where someone was tumbling down to their doom in a plane. I arrived a little too late...

The solution to get out of it was to pump the fuel forward, making the center of mass move forward. I said a few times: "Pump your fuel forwards"

...No answer. He had ample time to still make it out, but that was fading fast.

About 10 seconds before hitting the ground, I screamed into the chat box: "PUMP THE DARN STUFF!"

Then right after crashing, a reply: "Oh, pump the fuel. I should've pumped the fuel"

Good god that's hard to watch.

This and wanting to right click control surfaces so the aircraft/SSTOs don't jerk all over the place ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Well I know even the best person will still by human nature screw up something in VAB, and I never scream/become mad about that because I know if I were doing streaming I would be doing something similarly stupid in other places, and probably more often than they do.

And that's why I wasn't seriously watching the stream itself - I just listen to them talking mostly, and occasionally some ideas might strike and inspire me - wait, that sounds like my school days...

In addition to pretty much all of the above mentioned issues I have one other:

I really like a lot of the aesthetic design demonstrated by many of the people I watch on the twitches/youtubes, so I often tell myself I need to make something inspired by that design.

However, I'm also an engineer in real life which means that an irrational desire for efficiency and unrelenting hatred for all things inefficient has been drilled into my brain, meaning I can barely bring myself to add even a single structural panel to my craft for coolness/aesthetic purposes if it doesn't also have a functional purpose.

So yeah, when I watch other people's crafts I often go "OHMYGOD THAT'S SO PRETTY/COOL! I MUST BUILD SOMETHING LIKE THAT MYSELF!"

And then when I actually go to the VAB and try to build sometihng similar I tend to go "nonononononoNO I CAN'T put that part there, it doesn't serve any purpose! it'll just lower my delta-V! Why would I ever want to do that?!"

And somehow, I'm still obsessed with interplanetary long-range, no-refuel spaceplanes. One of the most innefficient ways of spacetravel.

My head is a weird place.

Look where your center of mass is, or how fast you are going and how far you tipped over- you had MechJeb push you 20 degrees one way and then instantly 25 in the opposite direction, and its the games fault your craft lost control?! Move this up, add wings here, and don't do X/Y/Z... or revert to launch and make the same exact mistakes again and again"
